sen.j: 今出川誠季（いまでがわ のぶすえ、正徳 (日本)3年9月17日 (旧暦)（1713年11月4日） - 延享3年6月13日 (旧暦)（1746年7月30日））は、江戸時代中期の公卿。
sen.e: Nobusue IMADEGAWA (born on November 4, 1713 and died on July 30, 1746) was Kugyo (a Court noble) in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 中御門天皇（114代）・桜町天皇（115代）の二帝にわたり仕え、官位は従二位権大納言まで進む。
sen.e: He served two Emperors, the Emperor Nakamikado (the 114th) and the Emperor Sakuramachi (the 115th) and rose to the official rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank), Dainagon (a chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 以降清華家当主として速いスピードで累進し、侍従・左近衛少将・左近衛中将を経て、享保20年（1735年）従三位に昇り公卿に列する。
sen.e: Since then, he got promoted quickly as the head of the Seiga family taking various positions such as Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff), Sakonoe no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of the Inner Palace Guards), and Sakonoe no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of the Inner Palace Guards) and then, in 1735, he rose to the official rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) to rank with Kugyo.
